50. Elijah knew of the covetous act of Gehazi because 
49. According to Hosea, one of the punishments for the sins of  A. it wasreported tohim 
 Isreal was that  B. hesawhim from afar 
 A. they would not recieve divine revelation  C. hewent with him in spirit 
 B. they would eat but would not be statisfied  D. he sawthe gifts with him 
 C. the LORD would send famine upon the land   
 D. their women would become barren.   
 
 
  CHRISTIAN  RELIGIOUS  KNOWLEDGE 2003  
 
 
A. measure the entire land 
B. share out the land 
C. know if it was god or bad 
D. know if it was flowing with milk and honey 
 
2. The two sons of Samuel that became Judges in ISrael 
were 
A. Joel and Abijah B. Abimelech and Abidjah 
C. Hophni and Phinehas C. Joel and Abimelech 
 
3. “Let us make man in our image, after our likeness...”In 
the statement above, in our image implies man 
A. becoming God 
B. being a representative of God and fellow men 
C. being like God 
becoming the exact picture of God 
 
4. The murmuring of the congregation in the wilderness 
against Moses and Aaron were an indication of the 
people’s 
A. lack of patience with them 
B. lack of faith in them 
C. fear of dying by the sword 
D. inability to get to the promise land 
 
5. When the glory of teh LORD appeared to moses and 
Aaron in the wilderness of Zin, the Lord said they 
should 
A. tell the rock before tehir eyes to yield its water 
B. strike the rock with rod to bring out water for 
them 
C. fetch water for the people and their cattle 
D. tell the people to go around teh rock 
 
6. The last event taht boosted Gideon’s courage to go 
against the Midianities was the 
A. apperance of the angel who called him a man 
of valour 
B. sign in which God caused teh dew to be on 
the fleece 
C. test God gave Gideon’s men at teh waterside 
D. dream told by the Midianities about the barley 
bread 
 
7. At the confirmation of the cocenent, after Moses had 
addressed the people, they answered and said, 
A. “We are going to obey the Lord our God” 
B. to beware of false prophets and teachers 
C. obeying fully the ten commandments 
D. We shall keep all the comamndments of God 
8. Saul visited the witch of Endor when he was beiseged 
by the 
A. Philistines B. Amorites 
C. Amalekites D. Moabites 
 
9. Why did Saul tell the Kenites to go away from among 
the Amalekites? 
A. God did not tell him to destroy the Kenites 
B. Saul married from the Kenites 
C. The Kenites showed kindness to Israel 
D. The Kenites had blood convenant with Israel 
 
10. “...And they shall be my people, and i will be their 
God...” This convenant was made with Israel through 
prophet 
A. Isaiah B. Jeremiah 
C. Amos D. Hosea 
 
11. How many sons of Jesse passed before Samuel before 
David was chosen as King? 
A. 5 B. 7 
C. 7 D. 8 
 
12. “Whoever does not come out after Saul and Samuel, so 
shall it be doen to his oxen!” 
A. The power of the Lord came upon them 
B. The dread of the Lord came upon them 
C. The spirit of the Lor came upon tehm 
D. The word of teh Lord came to them 
 
13. “ ... Do not forsake her, and she will keep you, love her 
and she will guard you ... ” 
A. intelligence B. wife 
C. knowledge D. wisdom 
 
14. Joseph was made prime minister iN Egypt 
A. interpreted teh dreams of Pharaoh’s servants 
in the prison 
B. resisted teh temptation by Potiphar’s wife was 
C. faithful and upright man 
D. Interpreted Pharaoh’s dream and counselled 
him to what to do 
 
15. Nehemiah in exile fuinctioned as the King’s 
A. guard. B. secretaru 
C. cupbearer D. adviser 
 
16. In days of Uzziah, Isaiah saw a vision concerning 
A. Samaria and Judah 
B. Judah and Jerusalem 
C. Samaria and Jerusalem 
D. Judah and Israel
